item.title: Cognitive heuristics and biases
item.description: Availability heuristic Let me illustrate this heuristic by the following conversation one of professors at UC Davis had with a friend of hers. I know there are no raccoons in Davis, but I saw one so they must be increasing in population. No, there have always been racoons here. There weren’t. I haven’t seen one ever before and I live here 10 years. I mean, I study that, so I know there have always been racoons here.
